channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Police and crime commissioners to be abolished, government to announce
item.description: System introduced in 2012 across England and Wales has faced criticism from police chiefs UK politics live – latest updates The controversial system o...

item.title: Germany expects Ukraine to ‘vigorously pursue the fight against corruption’, says Merz – Europe live
item.description: German chancellor and Zelenskyy discussed the recent corruption allegations against former members of the Ukrainian cabinet in a call earlier this mor...

item.title: EU investigates Google over ‘demoting’ commercial content from news media
item.description: Officials say effective invisibilty in search results could be leading to unfair ‘loss of revenue’ The EU has launched an investigation into Google Se...

item.title: US government reopens after shutdown with House to vote on Epstein files next week – politics live
item.description: Even if bill passes the House, it will still need to get through the Senate before files can be released Democrats appear more enthusiastic than Repub...

item.title: Ed Miliband urges Labour to move on after Starmer apologises to Streeting for hostile briefings from No 10 – UK politics live
item.description: Fallout from extraordinary briefing operation against Wes Streeting continues as calls grow for Starmer to sack his chief of staff Morgan McSweeney PA...

item.title: British Gas boss voices concerns over Scotland's energy jobs
item.description: Chris O'Shea, the boss of Centrica, which owns British Gas, says the energy transition is correct, but worries over the impact on jobs.

item.title: Ministers urge PM to sack whoever was behind anonymous briefings
item.description: Ed Miliband and Wes Streeting are urging the PM to take action over briefings to media about a challenge to his leadership.

item.title: UK's first small nuclear power station to be built in north Wales
item.description: Three small modular reactors are confirmed for the site, with the potential for up to eight.

item.title: Council visited wrong home to check on Sara Sharif the day before murder
item.description: A review into the run-up to her murder found "the system failed to keep her safe" and that race was a bar to reporting possible child abuse.

item.title: Gaming giant Valve unveils new Steam Machine console to rival Xbox and PlayStation
item.description: The Steam Machine is a console designed to allow gamers to play PC games on their TV.
